  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath1 be a closed oriented surface of genus @xmath2 regarded as the boundary of an oriented handlebody @xmath3 of the same genus .",
    "we fix a basis of @xmath4 as in figure [ fig : surface ] so that @xmath5 coincides with the subgroup @xmath6 of @xmath7 generated by @xmath8 .    , scaledwidth=55.0% ]    the module @xmath7 has a natural",
    "non - degenerate anti - symmetric bilinear form @xmath9 called the intersection pairing .",
    "it is easy to see that @xmath6 is a maximal direct summand of @xmath7 on which @xmath10 is restricted to the trivial one .",
    "such a submodule is said to be _",
    "lagrangian_. by using @xmath10 , we can naturally identify @xmath11 , @xmath12 and the subgroup @xmath13 of @xmath7 generated by @xmath14 .",
    "the _ mapping class group _ @xmath15 of @xmath1 is the group of isotopy classes of orientation preserving self - diffeomorphisms of @xmath1 . in this paper ,",
    "we focus on subgroups of @xmath15 which respect the above fixed lagrangian submodule @xmath6 of @xmath7 .",
    "more precisely , two groups @xmath16 are studied through their group ( co)homology .",
    "clearly , @xmath17 .",
    "we here call them _ lagrangian mapping class groups _ or _",
    "lagrangian subgroups_.    one motivation by which the author started to study these groups is that the groups @xmath18 and @xmath19 locate between @xmath15 and the _ torelli group _ @xmath20 , where the latter group consists of isotopy classes of self - diffeomorphisms of @xmath1 acting trivially on @xmath7 .",
    "moreover it should be pointed out that they are _ infinite _ index subgroups of @xmath15 . the importance to study infinite index subgroups of @xmath15 containing @xmath20",
    "will be explained in section [ subsec : oddmmm ] with the relationship to the ( non-)triviality problem of even _ miller - morita - mumford classes _",
    "@xmath21 pulled back to @xmath22 .",
    "the study of lagrangian subgroups has been done by several researchers and we here recall them briefly .",
    "hirose studied a generating system of @xmath18 in @xcite , where @xmath18 is called the _ homological handlebody group_. in fact , @xmath18 can be seen as a homological extension of another subgroup of @xmath15 called the handlebody mapping class group @xmath23 , where @xmath23 consists of isotopy classes of orientation preserving self - diffeomorphisms of @xmath1 which can be extended to a self - diffeomorphism of the handlebody @xmath3 of genus @xmath2 bounding @xmath1 .",
    "we can easily check that @xmath24 . note that , prior to hirose s work , birman gave a generating set of @xmath25 in @xcite and we can give a generating set of @xmath18 by combining this with johnson s finite generating set of @xmath20 ( see @xcite ) .    as for @xmath19 ,",
    "levine gave a series of investigations in @xcite .",
    "he defined a filtration of @xmath19 called the _",
    "lagrangian filtration _ , which is analogous to the johnson - morita filtration of @xmath20 , by applying the theory of johnson - morita homomorphisms with an appropriate modification so that it conforms well to @xmath19 .",
    "recently , @xmath18 and @xmath19 appear and play an important roles in the theory of finite - type invariants of 3-manifolds . see andersen - bene - meilhan - penner @xcite , cheptea - habiro - massuyeau @xcite , cheptea - le @xcite ( with a slightly different definition ) , garoufalidis - levine @xcite , and levine @xcite for example .",
    "however , it seems that investigations of @xmath18 and @xmath19 in many papers had been done separately .",
    "as we see in the sections below , it is natural to put @xmath18 on the top of the lagrangian filtration of @xmath19 and study them simultaneously as in the case of @xmath15 and @xmath20 .",
    "we here mention the contents of this paper .",
    "we first summarize the notation and fundamental facts on @xmath18 and @xmath19 in section [ sec : lagmcg ] .",
    "then we will discuss the following in order .",
    "* section [ sec : h1ilgb ] : determination of @xmath26 , * section [ sec : h_ur ] : determinations of @xmath27 and @xmath28 , * section [ sec : h1lgb ] : determination of @xmath29 and a lower bound of @xmath30 , * section [ sec : remark ] : remarks on higher ( co)homology of @xmath18 and @xmath19 .",
    "precisely speaking , we study in sections [ sec : h1ilgb ] and [ sec : h1lgb ] the lagrangian subgroups of a surface with one boundary component and then derive the statements for those of a closed surface in section [ sec : closed ] .    as a by - product",
    ", we will give a remark that the second homology of the full mapping class group of genus @xmath0 has @xmath31 as a direct summand ( theorem [ thm : h2m3b ] and corollary [ cor : h2m3 ] ) , where this group has been almost determined by korkmaz - stipsicz @xcite up to this @xmath31 summand .",
    "in this paper , we use the same notation @xmath32 for the homology of both topological spaces and groups unless otherwise stated .",
    "we refer to brown s book @xcite for generalities of group ( co)homology .",
    "we start from the following well - known exact sequence @xmath33 obtained from the action of @xmath15 on @xmath7 with @xmath34 , the torelli group .",
    "we identify @xmath7 with @xmath35 by using the ordered basis @xmath36 .",

    "the left hand side of the condition is equal to @xmath43 from this we see that if @xmath44 , then @xmath45 and @xmath46 is symmetric .",
    "this case corresponds to @xmath47 .",
    "that is , if we define @xmath48 then @xmath49 is a subgroup of @xmath50 and @xmath51 by definition .",
    "we have the exact sequence @xmath52 moreover , if @xmath44 and @xmath53 , then the matrix @xmath54 itself is symmetric . in this case , the subgroup @xmath55 is naturally isomorphic to the second symmetric power @xmath56 of @xmath6 because @xmath57 and @xmath54 is symmetric . by definition , @xmath58 and we have the exact sequence @xmath59 note that @xmath56 is a free abelian group . @xmath56 and",
    "@xmath49 are related by the exact sequence @xmath60 where the map @xmath61 assigns to each matrix its upper left block of size @xmath39 .",
    "note that this group extension has a splitting defined by @xmath62 using ( [ seq : s2ur ] ) , we obtain the exact sequence @xmath63 where we put @xmath64 .    in the subsequent sections",
    ", we will use the above exact sequences to discuss the homology of @xmath18 and @xmath19 .",
    "however , by a technical reason , we first consider the mapping class group @xmath65 of the surface @xmath66 obtained from @xmath1 by removing an open disk , where each mapping class is supposed to fix the boundary of @xmath66 pointwise , and its subgroups @xmath67 , @xmath68 and @xmath69 corresponding to @xmath18 , @xmath19 and @xmath20 respectively .",
    "exact sequences similar to the above hold for these groups .",

    "we begin our investigation by determining the first homology , namely the abelianization , of @xmath68 by using the five - term exact sequence @xmath72 associated with the group extension ( [ seq : s2l ] ) .",

    "first , he showed in @xcite that @xmath69 is finitely generated for @xmath70 .",
    "this fact together with the sequences ( [ seq : ur ] ) , ( [ seq : s2l ] ) imply that @xmath67 and @xmath68 are also finitely generated . at present",
    ", it is not known whether they are finitely presentable or not , where the same question for @xmath69 has been an important open problem .",

    "in @xcite , levine studied various ways for embedding the pure braid group @xmath171 of @xmath172 strands into @xmath65 and @xmath15 , where @xmath173 etc .",
    "we now use one of them defined as follows .",
    "let @xmath174 be a disk with @xmath2 holes .",
    "we take an embedding @xmath175 as in figure [ fig : embedding ] , where the belt circles of handles correspond to @xmath176 s in figure [ fig : surface ] .",
    "the mapping class group of @xmath174 , where the self - diffeomorphisms of @xmath174 are supposed to fix the boundary pointwise , is known to be isomorphic to the framed pure braid group of @xmath2 strands . here the framing counts how many times one gives dehn twists along each of the loops parallel to the inner boundary . for any choice of framings",
    ", we have a homomorphism from the pure braid group @xmath177 of @xmath2 strands to @xmath65 by extending each mapping class by identity on the outside of @xmath178 .",
    "we can easily check that the image of this map is contained in @xmath67 .",
    "consequently we have a homomorphism @xmath179 .",
    "similarly , we have a homomorphism from @xmath177 to @xmath18 also denoted by @xmath180 .    , scaledwidth=55.0% ]    [ thm : pure ] the induced map @xmath181 is injective .",
    "consider the induced map @xmath182 of the composite @xmath183 on cohomology . here",
    "the ring structure of @xmath184 was completely determined by arnold in @xcite , and in particular , it was shown that @xmath184 is a finitely generated free abelian group and is generated by degree @xmath107 elements as a ring .",
    "the former shows that @xmath185 is also finitely generated free abelian and the latter shows that @xmath182 is onto since it is clear from a presentation of @xmath177 ( see @xcite for example ) that @xmath186 is onto . by passing to homology , we see that @xmath187 is injective .",
    "the theorem follows from this .      finally , we discuss the rational cohomology of higher degrees of @xmath18 with relationships to characteristic classes of oriented @xmath1-bundles called _ miller - morita - mumford classes_.    here we recall the definition of miller - morita - mumford classes following morita @xcite .",
    "let @xmath188 be an oriented @xmath1-bundle over a closed oriented manifold @xmath54 .",
    "since @xmath1 is @xmath165 dimensional , the relative tangent bundle @xmath189 is a vector bundle over @xmath190 of rank @xmath165 .",
    "in particular , we can take its euler class @xmath191 .",
    "then @xmath114-th miller - morita - mumford class @xmath192 is defined by @xmath193 where @xmath194 is the gysin map .",
    "this construction is natural with respect to bundle maps , so that we can regard @xmath192 as a cohomology class in the classifying space .",
    "namely @xmath195 , where @xmath196 is the classifying space of the topological group @xmath197 of orientation preserving self - diffeomorphisms of @xmath1 with @xmath198-topology . by a theorem of earle - eells @xcite",
    ", we have @xmath199 .",
    "therefore @xmath200    now we ask whether @xmath201 , regarded as a rational cohomology class , survives in @xmath202 by the pull - back of @xmath203 . a partial answer to this question",
    "is given as follows ( see morita @xcite ) .",
    "it is known that every _ odd _",
    "class @xmath204 can be obtained as the pull - back of some class in @xmath205 , which implies that all the odd classes @xmath206 vanish in @xmath207 .",
    "however , this argument says nothing about _ even _",
    "classes @xmath208 and it has been a long standing problem to determine whether even classes @xmath208 vanish or not in @xmath207 .    the author s motivation for the study in this paper is to attack this problem by considering groups locating between @xmath15 and @xmath20 and investigating the behavior of @xmath192 on those groups . as an example of such a group ,",
    "some finite index subgroups including level @xmath6 mapping class groups defined as the kernel of the composite @xmath209 are often studied .",
    "however , finite index subgroups , say @xmath210 , can not answer to the above problem since there exists a transfer map @xmath211 such that @xmath212 is the multiplication by a positive integer @xmath213 $ ] , where @xmath214 denotes the inclusion . in particular , we see that the pull - back map on the rational cohomology is always injective for any finite index subgroup",
    ". therefore we shall need infinite index subgroups and we focus on @xmath18 and @xmath19 in this paper . at present",
    ", we can not give the final answer even for @xmath18 , but we now present an observation for odd classes , by which we finish this paper .",
    "[ lem : ur_gl ] if @xmath2 is sufficiently larger than @xmath215 , we have @xmath216    the @xmath217-term of the lyndon - hochschild - serre spectral sequence for the group extension ( [ seq : s2ur ] ) is given by @xmath218 our claim immediately follows once we show that @xmath219 if @xmath220 . since @xmath221 and it is easy to show that the invariant part @xmath222 is trivial , we can use borel s vanishing theorem @xcite to show that @xmath223 for any @xmath220 .    for every @xmath114",
    ", the @xmath224-st miller - morita - mumford class @xmath206 vanishes in @xmath225 if @xmath2 is sufficiently larger than @xmath114 .    in this proof , we discuss by using the cohomology of topological spaces .",
    "it is known that the group cohomology @xmath226 of a discrete group @xmath210 can be written as @xmath227 , where @xmath228 denotes the classifying space of @xmath210 .",
    "when @xmath210 is a lie group , we write @xmath229 for @xmath210 with @xmath198-topology and @xmath230 for @xmath210 with discrete topology .",
    "consider the following commutative diagram :    @xmath231   \\ar[d]^{b ( \\mathrm{id})^\\ast }   \\ar@{}[ddrr]|\\circlearrowleft & &   h^\\ast ( bgl(g,\\mathbb{r})^{c^\\infty};{\\mathbb{q } } )   \\ar[d]^{b ( \\mathrm{id})^\\ast } \\\\",
    "h^\\ast ( bsp(2g,\\mathbb{r})^{\\delta};{\\mathbb{q } } ) \\ar[d ] & &   h^\\ast ( bgl(g,\\mathbb{r})^{\\delta};{\\mathbb{q } } ) \\ar[d ] \\\\ h^\\ast ( bsp ( 2g,{\\mathbb{z}});{\\mathbb{q } } ) \\ar[d]^{b\\sigma^\\ast } \\ar[r ]   \\ar@{}[dr]|\\circlearrowleft &   h^\\ast ( bursp ( 2g);{\\mathbb{q } } ) \\ar[d]^{b(\\sigma|_{{\\mathcal{l}_g}})^\\ast } \\ar[r ] &   h^\\ast ( bgl ( g,{\\mathbb{z}});{\\mathbb{q } } ) \\\\",
    "h^\\ast ( b{\\mathcal{m}_g});{\\mathbb{q } } ) \\ar[r ] & h^\\ast ( b { \\mathcal{l}_g};{\\mathbb{q } } ) &   } \\ ] ] where @xmath232 denotes the identity map , which always gives a continuous map from @xmath210 with discrete topology to that with @xmath198 topology for a lie group @xmath210 , and all the arrows not indicated are pull - backs by the induced maps of inclusions on classifying spaces .",
    "we now assume that @xmath2 is sufficiently large .",
    "since @xmath233 is homotopy equivalent to the unitary group @xmath234 , we have @xmath235 and the latter is known to be isomorphic to the polynomial algebra @xmath236 $ ] generated by the chern classes @xmath237 independently in the stable range .",
    "this polynomial algebra @xmath236 $ ] is mapped onto @xmath238 $ ] in @xmath239 , and onto @xmath240 $ ] in @xmath241 .",

    "it was shown by milnor ( * ? ? ?",
    "* appendix ) that @xmath242 is trivial for @xmath243 . by combining this fact with lemma [ lem : ur_gl ] , the theorem follows .",
    "recently , giansiracusa - tillmann @xcite have proved a closely related result that odd miller - morita - mumford classes vanish in the _ integral _ cohomology of the handlebody subgroup @xmath23 for @xmath244 . in fact , they showed that odd miller - morita - mumford classes are in the kernel of the pull - back map on the integral cohomology by @xmath245 where @xmath246 is any 3-manifold @xmath246 with @xmath247 .",
    "the author would like to express his gratitude to professor sadayoshi kojima and professor shigeyuki morita for their encouragement and to yusuke kuno for useful discussions .",
    "the author also would like to thank andrew putman for his helpful comment .",
    "this research was supported by jsps research fellowships for young scientists and kakenhi ( no .  08j02356 and no .",
    "21740044 ) .",
    "j.  birman , r.  craggs , _ the @xmath10-invariant of 3-manifolds and certain structural properties of the group of homeomorphisms of a closed , oriented 2-manifold _ , trans .",
    "237 , ( 1978 ) 283309 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we focus on two kinds of infinite index subgroups of the mapping class group of a surface associated with a lagrangian submodule of the first homology of a surface . </S>",
    "<S> these subgroups , called lagrangian mapping class groups , are known to play important roles in the interaction between the mapping class group and finite - type invariants of 3-manifolds . in this paper , we discuss these groups from group ( co)homological point of view . </S>",
    "<S> the results include the determination of their abelianizations , lower bounds of the second homology and remarks on the ( co)homology of higher degrees . as a by - product of this investigation </S>",
    "<S> , we determine the second homology of the mapping class group of a surface of genus @xmath0 . </S>"
  ]
}
